SENT.plain: Pentoxifylline was first registered (in Germany) 20 years ago
Then its main action seemed to be vasodilatation
Later hemorheological effect, in particular on red cell deformability, were found
Independent of its pharmacological effects, the clinical effectiveness in peripheral and cerebral arterial disease is well established
More recently its action on leucocytes has gained interest
Both rheological and biochemical changes have been reported
This new knowledge will create new indications for pentoxifylline within the near future which possibly will go beyond angiology
